question_text: What is the primary cause for high radiation doses in CT?

options.A: Image intensifier with low conversion coefficient

question_text: What is the main consideration in choosing tube potential?

The difference in the image gray scale between closely adjacent regions on the image is termed?
This refers to the ability of an image system to distinctly depict two objects as they become smaller and closer together.
Which of the following is NOT a cause of blurring in radiographic imaging?
What is the best way to reduce motion blurring?
What is the major disadvantage of an electronic transmission of data in analog form?
Which is true regarding conversion of an analog signal to a digital form?

options.B: Reconversion back to analog is not possible
options.C: Sampling causes a loss of information

question_text: In X-ray production, what type of radiation is generated by the deceleration of an electron when deflected by atomic nucleus of the target material?
Which of the following is true regarding cathode of an X-ray tube?

options.B: Energy of electrons hitting it are mostly converted to heat

question_text: Reduction of the X-ray beam intensity toward the anode side of the X-ray field is called?
What is the most commonly used rare earth phosphor in intensifying screens nowadays?
What is the single most important parameter that influences the performance of a grid?

options.B: Height of interspaces in the grid
options.D: Width of interspaces in the grid

question_text: A film that has been exposed but not yet developed is said to possess a:
Which of the following chemical in a developer solution acts as a reducing agent that initiates developing of silver halide crystals?
Film viewing conditions in mammography should include:
Which of the following results to a higher breast dose?
The principal component of the imaging chain that distinguishes fluoroscopy from radiography is the:
Which method reduces the patient radiation dose during fluoroscopic procedures?

options.D: Use of smallest field of view

question_text: What is the ultrasound artifact seen when "pseudo-sludge" is noted in an otherwise normal gallbladder?
The preferred Doppler angle in degrees:
One of the advantages of computed radiography over screen-film radiography is?

options.A: It has a higher quantum noise at high exposures
options.B: It has a much larger dynamic range
options.C: It has a narrower exposure latitude
options.D: It results in higher x-ray dose to the patient

question_text: Which of the following statements is true regarding digital and conventional radiography?

options.A: Contrast resolution of digital radiography is the same as that of conventional radiography
options.B: Digital and conventional radiography has no significant change in the spatial resolution of images
options.C: The ability to readjust the contrast image after detection is a feature of screen-film radiography
options.D: The improvement in contrast resolution in digital radiography out-weighs the slight loss of spatial resolution

question_text: This sequence uses a longer T1 to reduce the signal level of CSF:
This standard was formulated to facilitate the transfer, storage and display of images acquired on equipment by various vendors:

options.A: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

question_text: Which among the following is NOT considered as an advantage of PACS?

options.A: Ability for more than one clinician to simultaneously view the same images

question_text: What is the most common bioeffect of MR systems?

The normal exposure of individuals shall be restricted so that neither the total effective dose nor the total equivalent dose to relevant organs or tissues, caused by the possible combination of exposures from authorized practices, exceeds any relevant dose limit. This refers to what principle?
By IAEA standard, what is the effective radiation dose limit in mSv in a single year for occupational exposure?
Which is true of the helical CT scan:

options.A: A cine CT scanner developed specifically for cardiac tomographic imaging
options.C: The x-ray source moves around the patient while the table is moving.
options.D: The x-ray tube rotates and the detectors are stationary.

question_text: The slice thickness in multiple detector array CT scanners is determined by:
A CT scan artifact where a CT slice evaluates a slab of tissue containing 2 or more different tissue types is:
Which of the following factors affect contrast resolution?
Which is the typical conservative assumption used in shielding design?

options.A: Attenuation by the patient and image receptor is usually not considered.
options.B: Distances are the maximum possible all the time.
options.C: Staff members are seldom in the most exposed place of the room.
options.D: Workload, use and occupancy factors are accurately estimated.

question_text: According to the Basic Safety Standard (BSS) classification of work areas, which is considered a controlled area?
The purpose of regular monitoring and dose assessment procedure for radiation health workers is to:

options.A: Award hazard pay to deserving workers
options.B: Circulate workers in the different work areas of the department
options.D: Estimate fetal dose in a pregnant Rad Tech

question_text: Which of the following is an evidence based practice?

options.A: Radiologic procedures with contrast scheduled in accordance with patient's menstrual cycle
options.B: Reduce or avoid fetal exposure during radiologic examination whenever possible.
options.C: Therapeutic abortion recommended for women after whole abdomen CT Scan in 1st trimester
options.D: Warn women against undergoing chest X-ray during pregnancy

question_text: Which of the following fetal radiation exposure effects has the lowest risk of occurring?
Which of the following assists in distinguishing benign from malignant lesion in nuclear medicine?
Which type of collimator in a scintillation camera is commonly used to produce magnified views of small objects, such as the thyroid or a hip joint?
Although there are many positron-emitting radiopharmaceuticals, the clinical importance of PET today is largely due to its ability to image:
The exposure rate at 20 cm from a point source of radiation is 90 mR/hr. Increasing the distance to 60 cm decreases the exposure to:
The concept of STOCHASTIC effect of radiation applies to which of the following?

options.A: A threshold dose can be defined below which the effect will not occur.
options.B: It is caused by damage to the cell that produces genetically transformed but reproductively viable descendants.
options.C: It includes teratogenic effects to the embryo or fetus.
options.D: The severity of the effect increases with the dose.

question_text: The protective apron used by interventional radiology staff should have lead equivalence of at least:
Which is true about radiation protection?

options.A: Lead aprons should be worn by radiology personnel while operating mobile X-ray equipment.
options.B: Personal monitoring badges should be issued every 6 weeks in general radiology.
options.C: The primary responsibility for identification of pregnant patients rests with the radiology staff, while the referring doctor provides a secondary back-up.
options.D: The x-ray tube should not be used any closer than 0.5 meter to the console area.

question_text: The most important method in reducing fluoroscopic exposure is:

options.B: Maintaining as much distance as possible between the X-ray tube and the patient's skin.
options.D: Restriction of the field size with collimation.
